title: Hank Ruszkowski
text:
Henry Alexander Ruszkowski (November 10, 1925 – May 31, 2000) was an <a href="Americans">American</a> <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> <a href="baseball%20player">player</a>. A <a href="catcher">catcher</a>, he appeared in 40 <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League</a> <a href="games%20played">games</a> over parts of three seasons for the <a href="Cleveland%20Indians">Cleveland Indians</a> (1944–1945; 1947). Listed at , , Ruszkowski batted and threw <a href="right-handed">right-handed</a>. He was born in <a href="Cleveland%2C%20Ohio">Cleveland, Ohio</a>.
During his Major League career, Ruszkowski was a .238 <a href="batting%20average%20%28baseball%29">hitter</a> (<a href="hit%20%28baseball%29">20</a>-for-<a href="at%20bats">84</a>) with three <a href="home%20run">home run</a>s, two <a href="double%20%28baseball%29">doubles</a> and a .310 <a href="on-base%20percentage">on-base percentage</a>. He also played seven <a href="minor%20league%20baseball">minor league</a> seasons between 1944 and 1954, appearing in 298 games.
Ruszkowski died in his native Cleveland at the age of 74.
